title: AD to miss Mavs' next 2 games with calf strain
content: Anthony Davis will miss the Dallas Mavericks' next two games because of a low grade left calf strain, the team said on Friday.

title: Sources: SMU, Lashlee nearing lucrative new deal
content: Rhett Lashlee and SMU are closing in on a new agreement that is expected to place him among the 10 highest-paid coaches in college football, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Arch off Texas injury report, set to start vs. Vandy
content: Texas quarterback Arch Manning was not listed on the SEC's injury report released Friday night after spending the week in concussion protocol.

title: NBA refs to start wearing headsets during games
content: NBA referees will begin using headsets during regular-season games for the first time beginning Saturday.

title: Police look into break-in at home owned by SGA
content: Oklahoma City police are investigating a burglary that took place at the home of Shai Gilgeous-Alexander on Thursday night, when the Thunder were playing at home against the Wizards.

title: NCAA to allow JSU to hire ex-Vol Pruitt as analyst
content: The NCAA informed Jacksonville State it could hire former Tennessee coach Jeremy Pruitt as an analyst, the school announced on Friday.

title: Wrexham hail 'statement win' with Moore hat trick
content: Phil Parkinson revelled in a "statement performance and win" as Wrexham ended Coventry's unbeaten record -- the last one in the English Football League.

title: NCAA gambling probe widens pre-hoops season
content: An NCAA gambling investigation, with links to the NBA betting scandal, is impacting the status of multiple players at several schools, according to sources familiar with the probe.

title: NBA Cup: Let's project group favorites and the teams fighting for a wild-card spot
content: The third edition of the in-season tournament tips off on Friday. Let's take a look at who has the best chance to advance to Vegas in December.

content: Breaking down the fits of every top 2026 commitment, including Vandy's highest-rated recruit since Mikayla Blakes.

title: Tudor's Juve exit means McKennie must prove himself all over again
content: Weston McKennie has already proven himself to several Juventus managers, but with Igor Tudor getting fired, he now has another new boss to impress.

title: WNBA, union agree to CBA extension -- what's next in negotiations?
content: The league and WNBPA agreed to a 30-day extension of the current CBA. How did we get here and what happens next?

title: 'I didn't even know he was a gambler': How the Blazers and NBA are grappling with Chauncey Billups' stunning downfall
content: The questions inside the Blazers' locker room and across the NBA are the same: How do we reconcile the man we thought we knew -- and a man the federal government believes is a criminal?

title: Briscoe, Byron, Hamlin, Larson: Who will be crowned NASCAR champion on Sunday?
content: Just four drivers are left standing in NASCAR's 2025 playoffs, and come Sunday afternoon in Phoenix, one of them will be crowned Cup Series champion.

content: NYC Marathon pacers are the human metronomes keeping runners on track in the race's most challenging moments.

content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Drake Maye overtakes Patrick Mahomes as top QB
content: At Week 9, what should fantasy managers believe, or not believe, about Drake Maye, Oronde Gadsden II and more?

title: Expert picks, best bets: Two win streaks on the line at UFC Fight Night
content: One fighter's unbeaten streak will come to an end when David Onama and Steve Garcia clash at UFC Fight Night. MMA experts and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Risers and fallers: Trade for Trae Young, trade away Austin Reaves
content: Steve Alexander highlights fantasy basketball names trending upwards or downwards, with key takeaways for each.

title: Hallo-not: Packers HC Matt LaFleur dismisses Halloween, focused on Panthers matchup
content: The Green Bay Packers coach isn't fond of the Halloween spirit and is looking past trick-or-treat to Sunday's game.

title: Nebraska's black alternate uniforms headline best Week 10 threads in CFB
content: The Cornhuskers are going with an all-black look for their prime-time matchup with USC on Saturday night.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Clock ticking for Santiago Gimenez at AC Milan
content: Santiago Gimenez's future at AC Milan has become increasingly in doubt. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

content: The last rites were performed in the presence of Arya's wife, son and other close members of his family

content: The Purnea MP criticised the BJP government on the rising violence across States, asking if this is not a big goon State, then what is it?

title: Marathon training sessions held at West Bengal CEOâs office for SIR
content: 3,000 officials were trained on Friday on how to the BLOs (Booth Level Officials) will use a mobile application to fill in enumeration forms.

title: Calcutta HC to hear petition demanding court-monitored SIR in WB, as Trinamool starts preparations
content: Trinamool Congress general secretary Abhishek Banerjee held a meeting with the partyâs rank and directed partyâs booth level agents BLAs not to leave Booth Level Officers BLOs for a minute during SIR

title: October ends with excess rainfall over T.N. for second consecutive year; IMD indicates below normal rains in November
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecast November rainfall in the State to be likely below normal rainfall.

title: Vellore Corporation begins desilting of old drains in Netaji market to prevent inundation
content: Corporation officials said that the existing Netaji wholesale market, which is 1.5 acres, has 982 shops including 282 retail outlets.

title: Headmaster suspended in Tiruvannamalai for social media posts against State government
content: Initial inquiry revealed that the headmaster has been making comments against government welfare schemes and other initiatives in various social media platforms regularly.

title: Two persons held for selling tablets near Walajah
content: Accordingly, a special police team was conducting a routine check near Walajah railway station when the team found the duo selling the tablets in a dilapidated building.

title: VIT Chancellor receives Lifetime achievement award
content: According to a press release, the award was given at the eighth Annual Conclave Federation of World Academics (FWA) held in New Delhi.

title: Kurnool accident: Trapped in a burning bus
content: On the morning of October 24, a sleeper bus caught fire on a national highway, killing 19 passengers and injuring several others. Initial investigations by the Andhra Pradesh police indicate that the bus collided with a motorcycle lying in the middle of the road, which was reportedly driven by a drunken man. Marri Ramu and P. Hareesh report on the tragedy that has also exposed how the private operator of a âluxury busâ failed to adhere to basic safety norms

title: EC seeks report from Bihar DGP on murder of Jan Suraaj Party supporter in Mokama
content: Tension has gripped Mokama after the murder of Jan Suraaj Party supporter Dularchand Yadav, ahead of the Assembly polls

title: Air India concludes phase 1 of retrofit of old planes
content: The 27 revamped narrowbodies will be utilised for as many as 3,024 weekly flights on 82 domestic and short-haul-international routes, the airline saidÂ

title: Even detours are jammed: Secunderabad motorists crawl through narrow, battered bylanes
content: Spillover from Paradise-Dairy Farm Road elevated corridor work turns Secunderabadâs inner roads into a commuter maze

title: Jharkhand migrant caught in crossfire in Saudi Arabia dies, Govt makes effort to bring back body
content: The youth identified as Vijay Kumar Mahato had been working in a private company as a tower line fitter for the last nine months.

title: Activist seeks probe into âfake encounter of Rohit AryaÂ to cover up Governmentâs failuresâ
content: Advocate Nitin Satpute demands independent probe into hostage-takerâs death; questions raised over unpaid dues, police conduct, and government accountability.Â

title: Bihar polls: âPeople have decided to bring change,â says Tejashwi Yadav | Interview
content: Mahagatbandhan will win as people want that those who talk about education, irrigation, medicine, jobs, and prompt action should form govt., says RJD leader and the Chief Ministerial face of the Opposition bloc; he says JD(U) will cease to exist after the polls as he rules out any tie-up with Nitish

title: Regime changes in Bangladesh, Nepal, and Sri Lanka were due to poor governance: Doval
content: The National Security Advisor said that governance plays a âseminal roleâ in ânation-building processâ and in securing the nation-state

title: From fight for unification to anti-Hindi push: many phases of Kannada activism
content: From the 1990s to now, the Kannada movement has gone through many shifts, even as some themes have remained the same

title: From reaping riches to facing challenges, horticulture switch leaves Rayalaseema farmers in a fix
content: The growth story of horticultural crop cultivation in the Rajampeta region of Annamayya district inspired many professionals, including those from the software industry, to take up farming. The semi-arid Rayalaseema climate, red sandy loam soils, and ancient tank-based irrigation systems helped farmers â who once relied on rain-fed crops like groundnut and pulses â gradually shift to fruit-bearing trees and vegetables. However, drastic weather changes, recurring crop diseases, and a lack of marketing facilities and government support have left many in distress. K. Umashanker delves deep into the regionâs changing agricultural dynamics and its drawbacks

title: Safety concerns over stadium in Kannur mount ahead of football league
content: The ground will serve as the home venue for Kannur Warriors FC, which will play its first Super League Kerala match here on November 7

title: Contract workers stage protest at Ambedkar Smriti Vanam, seek immediate payment of pending salaries
content: They allege that VMC officials and police tried to bring in sanitation workers to carry out the task of cleaning up the place, but they resisted

title: Defeat of Congress in Jubilee Hills bypoll to benefit 4 crore people in State: KTR
content: He holds roadshow in the constituency in support of Maganti Sunitha, says just sense of defeat forced ruling party to induct a Muslim into Cabinet

title: Watch | NDA promises jobs, infra boost in its Bihar election manifesto
content: The NDA released its election manifesto on October 31, 2025, in the presence of CM Nitish Kumar, BJP president J.P. Nadda, and other NDA leaders. Here are the highlights.

title: Bihar polls a fight between dark rule under RJD and bright era of NDA: BJP chief Nadda
content: J.P. Nadda said that Bihar has come on the track of development under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, âand we need to keep this track safe and soundâ

title: 'If they're going to do it ... ': Trump doubles down on nuclear testing plan
content: President Trump announced the US will resume nuclear testing, citing actions by Russia and China. This decision reverses a long-standing moratorium, raising concerns about environmental hazards and global tensions. Experts question the technical necessity, while allies warn of an arms race.

title: 'Disgusting': JD Vance says his wife Usha has no plans to convert to Christianity
content: Vice President JD Vance addressed social media speculation regarding his interfaith marriage, clarifying that his wife Usha, a Hindu, has no plans to convert to Christianity. Vance stated that Usha encouraged his re-engagement with his faith and expressed his hope that she might one day share his beliefs, emphasizing his continued love and support for her.

title: 'Too many batters, not enough balance' - Ex-Oz captain questions India's strategy
content: Former Australia captain Aaron Finch urged India to reinstate Arshdeep Singh, criticising their batting-heavy lineup for a lack of balance and bowling penetration. Finch believes too many batters can dilute responsibility, and Team India needs the right combinations for the World Cup. He also noted that India's bowlers defended an insufficient total.

title: How AI is behind mass layoffs, but also creating the jobs that replace them
content: Big Tech is firing thousands even as it pours billions into artificial intelligence. The Great Tech Paradox of the 21st Century explores how companies like Meta, Google, and Accenture are reshaping the workforceâcutting roles while hiring new ones to power the AI boom. From mass layoffs to the race for machine learning talent, the story unpacks how automation, efficiency, and inequality are colliding to redefine work in the age of intelligent machines.

title: Exclusive - 'Didn't get enough chances': Parvez Rasool questions the system
content: Parvez Rasool, the first cricketer from Jammu and Kashmir to represent India, reflects on his impactful career and looks back on his retirement. He highlights the significant progress in J&K cricket, attributing it to opening doors for aspiring players. Rasool also discusses the challenges faced by domestic performers from smaller states and the overshadowing effect of IPL performances over consistent domestic achievements.

title: On top of the world! Babar Azam breaks Rohit Sharma's big T20 record; PAK crush SA
content: Pakistan's Babar Azam has become the leading scorer in men's T20 internationals, surpassing Rohit Sharma. Azam achieved this milestone during Pakistan's dominant nine-wicket victory over South Africa, leveling the series. Youngster Saim Ayub also shone with an unbeaten 71, guiding Pakistan to a swift chase after their bowlers restricted South Africa to 110.

title: 'Young people are ...': JP Morgan CEO responds to petition asking flexibility in hybrid mode
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon has doubled down on his opposition to remote work, dismissing employee concerns over the bank's strict five-day return-to-office policy. Dimon argued that junior bankers are disadvantaged by working from home, missing out on crucial learning opportunities. This stance follows a controversial town hall where he reportedly dismissed a 2,000-signature petition. The bank's new headquarters and the end of its hybrid policy underscore its commitment to in-person work, a decision framed as strategic despite employee pushback.

title: India, US ink new defence framework for 10 yrs; aim to deepen cooperation in all domains
content: India and the US have inked an expansive 10-year defense framework to deepen strategic partnership, aiming to enhance cooperation across all domains. This move signals a renewed commitment to regional stability and safeguarding a free and open Indo-Pacific, despite ongoing trade tensions and shifting US priorities.

title: Bihar polls: NDA promises 1 cr jobs, infra push; plans new cities, airports in state vision
content: The NDA unveiled its Bihar election manifesto, promising over one crore employment opportunities through skill development and infrastructure projects. The alliance also focused on welfare schemes, including financial aid for women and EBC youth, and pledged to top up PM-KISAN support with an additional annual payout.

title: IND vs AUS: 'Please, play him!' - Ashwin slams Team India over Arshdeep's exclusion
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has criticised India's team management for excluding Arshdeep Singh from the playing XI against Australia. Ashwin argued that if experimentation was the goal, Jasprit Bumrah should have been rested instead of Arshdeep, India's leading T20I wicket-taker. He emphasised Arshdeep's consistent performance and asserted his right to a regular spot in the team.

title: Amazon cuts 14,000 jobs: CEO Andy Jassy breaks silence; what he said
content: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy revealed that the recent layoff of 14,000 employees isn't due to financial woes or AI, but rather a cultural shift. He explained that rapid growth led to increased layers and diluted ownership, slowing down operations. This contrasts with other executive statements emphasizing AI's transformative role and the need for leaner structures.

title: Juvenile's conviction is not a bar to govt service, rules Allahabad HC
content: The Allahabad High Court ruled that a conviction under the Juvenile Justice Act does not disqualify individuals from service appointments. This decision came after a Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya teacher was dismissed for concealing a childhood offense. The court reinstated the teacher, emphasizing that juvenile convictions should not lead to disqualification.

title: China ships always on radar: Navy vice chief
content: India is closely monitoring Chinese warships and spy vessels in the Indian Ocean Region, with at least 40-50 operating there at any given time. This comes as India prepares to host the 'Milan' maritime exercise and International Fleet Review in Visakhapatnam, featuring navies from the US, Russia, Japan, and Australia, while excluding China and Pakistan.

title: 'Knocking at the door': Suryavanshi set for India call-up? IPL chief hails bench strength
content: IPL Chairman Arun Dhumal lauded India's bench strength and the enduring class of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. Dhumal highlighted Rohit's Player of the Series performance against Australia, showcasing his conviction and work ethic, and expressed confidence in their continued contributions to Indian cricket.

title: Will Luka Doncic play tonight vs Grizzlies? Latest update on his injury status
content: Luka Doncic's return for the Lakers against the Grizzlies is a game-time decision, with the star listed as questionable due to finger and leg injuries. Despite his absence, the Lakers have shown resilience, winning two of their last three games. His availability could significantly impact the game's outcome, but the team has proven capable of competing even without him.

title: Blake Livelyâs woes deepen amid Justin Baldoni case as Taylor Swift cuts ties
content: Blake Lively is reportedly facing a deepening legal battle with her "It Ends With Us" co-star Justin Baldoni, as his former agent accused her of "extortion."  Adding to her troubles, Lively's friendship with Taylor Swift has reportedly ended, leaving her concerned about career repercussions and her husband's reputation.

title: Is Joel Embiid playing tonight vs Celtics? Latest 76ers injury update
content: Joel Embiid is set to play for the Philadelphia 76ers against the Boston Celtics in their NBA Cup opener on October 31, 2025. Despite managing knee issues with a 20-minute restriction, his return provides a significant boost. The Sixers aim to maintain their perfect start and gain an early edge in the tournament.

title: Shane Bieberâs wife reacts to Sofia Castanedaâs World Series post, sparking buzz
content: Blue Jays catcher Alejandro Kirk's stellar World Series performance is matched by the heartwarming social media buzz surrounding his wife, Sofia Castaneda. A simple emoji comment from Shane Bieber's wife, Kara, on Sofia's post celebrating Kirk's success ignited a viral moment, highlighting the strong camaraderie among the team's families and captivating fans.

title: Who is Marissa Ayers? Giants rookie Jaxson Dart reportedly dating
content: New York Giants quarterback Jaxson Dart is reportedly dating model Marissa Ayers, sparking significant buzz.  The pair were seen together at a Halloween party, fueling speculation across social media. Ayers, a popular ring card girl and influencer, has a substantial following. Their rumored romance is being hailed by fans as a potential new power couple in the sports world.

title: Berlin airport briefly halts flights after unidentified drone sightings
content: Berlin Brandenburg Airport experienced flight suspensions for nearly two hours due to unidentified drone sightings, a recurring issue across Europe.  Take-offs and landings were halted, leading to flight diversions, as police investigated the drone incursions. This incident highlights a growing "hybrid threat" concern for Germany and other European nations.

title: 2 Army personnel sentenced to life imprisonment for sexual assault of 4-yr-old child
content: Two Army personnel have been sentenced to life imprisonment by a special Pocso court in Berhampur for the sexual assault of a four-year-old girl. The horrific incident occurred on a school bus transporting children of defence personnel. The court also imposed a Rs 10,000 fine on each convict and directed compensation for the victim.

title: FBI stops âISIS-styleâ Halloween attack after decoding eerie âpumpkin dayâ reference
content: The FBI thwarted a potential ISIS-inspired attack in Michigan just before Halloween, arresting multiple suspects who allegedly planned a "pumpkin day" assault. Months of online surveillance and an undercover operative led to the arrests, preventing a violent attack over the holiday weekend.

title: 'Ben Austin was only 17 â¦': Dhawan pens heartfelt message; cricket mourns tragic loss
content: Seventeen-year-old Australian cricketer Ben Austin tragically passed away after sustaining fatal injuries during a net session. The incident has sent shockwaves through the cricket community, prompting tributes and renewed discussions on player safety.  The loss has evoked painful memories of Phillip Hughes and led to widespread mourning.

title: November likely to be quite pleasant in large parts of India: IMD
content: November nights are predicted to be warmer than usual across most of India, with the exception of some northwest regions. Day temperatures are expected to be normal to below normal, contributing to a pleasant month nationwide. October saw significantly higher rainfall than average, marking it as the second wettest since 2001.

title: Taylor Swift steps out in chic brown look, shows off Travis Kelce engagement ring
content: Taylor Swift set the tone for fall 2025 in New York City with an elegant monochrome brown ensemble. The pop megastar's sophisticated look, featuring a turtleneck sweater dress and suede boots, embraced autumn's cozy palette. She also proudly displayed her engagement ring from Travis Kelce, proving her impeccable style continues to command attention.

title: Mallikarjun Kharge, BJP slug it out after Congress chief calls for ban on RSS
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge called for a ban on the RSS, citing Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel's decision and accusing the organization of endangering national unity. The BJP countered by recalling Patel and Mahatma Gandhi's praise for the RSS, accusing Kharge of echoing fundamentalist groups.

title: IFTDA clarifies Rohit Arya had no link with the film or TV industry after Powai hostage crisis
content: The Powai hostage crisis has left Mumbaiâs entertainment community in disbelief. The man at the center of the horrifying incident, 38-year-old Rohit Arya, who held 19 peopleâincluding 17 children and a senior citizenâhostage inside an acting studio, had allegedly posed as someone associated with the film industry. In the aftermath of the tragedy, the Indian Film & Television Directors' Association (IFTDA) issued a strongly worded statement, clarifying that Arya had no connection whatsoever with the Indian film or television fraternity.

title: Is Jamal Murray playing tonight? Nuggets face setback ahead of Blazers clash
content: Denver Nuggets star Jamal Murray faces an uncertain future for the NBA Cup opener against Portland Trail Blazers. Murray's left calf tightness has him listed as questionable. This setback follows a brilliant start to the 2025-26 season. Coach David Adelman must consider limiting his minutes or resting him to avoid further injury.

title: Top cardiologist reveals the best exercise to lower blood pressure naturally
content: The American Heart Association suggests that adults aim for 150 minutes of moderateâintensity aerobic activity each week, which can be broken down into five 30âminute sessions. A brisk walk, a bike ride or a swim, all count toward that goal. Dr. London stresses that weaving exercise into routines is the most reliable way to secure heart health, and keep blood pressure in check

title: Since both are probe agencies, how can ED force police to act on its findings, asks Madras HC
content: Madras High Court questioned the Enforcement Directorate's approach in seeking court directions for Tamil Nadu police to register cases based on ED's information regarding illegal sand mining. The court also questioned the ED's role in directing other investigating agencies, while the state police opposed being treated as a 'post office'.

title: Dharmendra admitted to ICU after complaining of breathlessness; condition stable
content: Veteran Bollywood superstar Dharmendra has been admitted to Breach Candy Hospital in Mumbai after reportedly complaining of breathlessness, as per latest development. The 89-year-old actor has been under strict medical supervision for the past few days and is currently in the Intensive Care Unit (ICU).

title: Assembly polls: Sops set to turn Bihar's weak fiscal situation precarious
content: Bihar's fiscal health is poised to worsen regardless of the election outcome, with both NDA and Mahagathbandhan making costly promises. The state already faces revenue challenges due to prohibition, and new pledges like government jobs and increased pensions will strain its budget significantly, exacerbating its already precarious financial situation.

title: Texas Longhorns superfan Scott Wilson dies at 74 after 25 yrs of attendance
content: Devoted Texas Longhorns fan Scott Wilson, 74, passed away Friday. An Austin lawyer and proud UT alum, Wilson was hospitalized in Florida after a medical emergency while traveling to a game. He hadn't missed a Texas baseball game in over 25 years and was planning to attend his 595th consecutive football game.

title: 'Frustrated, but never gave up': Pant opens up on emotional comeback - watch
content: Rishabh Pant has successfully returned to competitive cricket, captaining India A in a four-day match against South Africa A after a challenging recovery from a foot fracture. He described the rehabilitation process as demanding, emphasizing the crucial role of positivity and the facilities and support at the Centre of Excellence in his comeback.

title: 'Sorry patra': Tejashwi, Cong tear into NDA's Bihar manifesto; mock press event
content: Bihar's ruling NDA alliance launched its election manifesto, "Sankalp Patra," promising jobs and development. The opposition Mahagathbandhan, led by Tejashwi Yadav, dismissed it as "jumla," demanding an apology for the state's alleged failures over 20 years of NDA rule. Congress echoed the criticism, questioning the manifesto's timing and the chief minister's limited role.

title: Haryana men captured in Iran: 'Donkers' demanding ransom, claim kin; seek govt's help
content: Two young men from Haryana's Karnal district, promised jobs in Spain, are now held captive in Iran. Traffickers are reportedly torturing them and threatening to sell their kidneys if a ransom isn't paid. Their families have filed a police complaint and are appealing to the government for their safe return.

title: '$200mn an hour, oversubscription'! India's IPO market booming
content: India's IPO market is experiencing a significant boom, driven by strong domestic investor participation. Companies like LG Electronics India and Lenskart Solutions Ltd. have seen rapid oversubscriptions, positioning India as a leading global IPO destination. This surge reflects deep local liquidity and a fundamental shift towards a self-sufficient equity ecosystem.

title: Terror attack foiled in US: FBI chief offers details; arrests made in Michigan
content: The FBI successfully thwarted a potential terrorist attack planned for Michigan's Halloween weekend, arresting multiple subjects allegedly involved in the plot. Director Kash Patel credited law enforcement for their vigilance in defending the homeland. Authorities assure the public there is no ongoing threat to the community.

title: 'Oh, is he?': Abhishek Sharmaâs hilarious reaction to reporter's question - Watch
content: Australia's pace spearhead Josh Hazlewood will miss the remainder of the T20I series against India to focus on domestic cricket and prepare for the Ashes. Hazlewood's absence is a relief for Indian batters after his match-winning spell in the second T20I. Abhishek Sharma, despite facing Hazlewood's precision, enjoyed the challenge of batting against a world-class bowler.

title: Tanzania crisis: Over 700 protesters dead, says oppn; what triggered unrest?
content: Tanzania's opposition party, Chadema, claims around 700 people have died in election protests, alleging widespread fraud. The government has imposed an internet blackout and curfew amid violent clashes between demonstrators and security forces. The UN has urged restraint and condemned the use of force.

title: NDTV Bihar Election Conclave Live Updates: Prashant Kishor Speaks At NDTV's Power Play - Bihar
content: All eyes are on Patna today, as NDTV's Power Play - Bihar is set to bring national and the state's leading political voices for debates and discussions that are expected to shape the course of the upcoming assembly elections.

title: Top Israeli General Resigns Over Probe Into Leak Of Detainee Abuse Video
content: The Israeli military's chief legal officer resigned on Friday over a criminal inquiry into the leaking of a video that appeared to show soldiers abusing a Palestinian detainee arrested during the Gaza war.

title: Centre Says Textiles, Gems And Jewellery Exports Grow In Non-US Markets
content: India's exports of textiles, gems and jewellery, and marine products recorded healthy growth in several non-US markets during January-September 2025, reflecting a broad-based diversification in the country's outbound shipments.

title: Weak Governance Led To Regime Change In Bangladesh, Nepal, Sri Lanka: Ajit Doval
content: National Security Advisor (NSA) Ajit Doval said on Friday that governance plays a seminal role in nation-building and in securing a nation, enabling it to achieve its goals and fulfil the aspirations of the common man.

title: Mumbai Civic Body Allows "Controlled Feeding" Of Pigeons For Only 2 Hours
content: Mumbai's civic body on Friday said it has permitted "controlled feeding" of pigeons at four new locations in the city for two hours in the morning.

title: Solid Gold Toilet Up For Auction In US, Starting At $10 Million
content: Sotheby's announced Friday that it will auction off the solid gold cistern, a sculpture by Italian artist Maurizio Cattelan entitled "America."

title: Aviation Body Allows Limited Exemption For Air India's Long-Haul 787 Flights
content: The aviation watchdog has granted Air India a limited exemption permitting select long-haul Boeing 787 flights to exceed standard flight and duty time limits only when the flight time and duty period increase after departure.

title: North Korea Says Denuclearisation Is Unrealisable "Pipe Dream"
content: North Korea said on Saturday that denuclearisation of the Korean peninsula, which South Korea said will be discussed in a summit with China later that day, is an unrealisable "pipe dream," according to state media KCNA.

title: Flights Temporarily Suspended At Berlin Airport Over Drone scare
content: Flights were suspended for almost two hours at Berlin Brandenburg Airport on Friday due to sightings of unidentified drones, the latest in a series of similar scares across Europe, an airport spokesman told AFP.

title: White House Restricts Reporters' Access To Part Of Press Office
content: US President Donald Trump's administration on Friday barred reporters from accessing part of the White House press office without an appointment, citing the need to protect "sensitive material."

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs Transferred To New Jersey Prison To Serve Jail Term
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs has been transferred to a prison in New Jersey to serve out the remainder of his four-year prison sentence on prostitution-related charges.

title: Trump Rejects Resuming Canada Trade Talks After Ad Dispute
content: US President Donald Trump on Friday flatly rejected any resumption of trade negotiations with Canada, one week after interrupting talks amid a dispute over an anti-tariff advertisement.

title: Trump Says Christians Face "Existential Threat" In Nigeria
content: US President Donald Trump said on Friday that Christianity faces a threat in Nigeria and he was adding the West African nation to a State Department watch list.

title: US Court Orders Trump To Keep Food Aid Flowing During Shutdown
content: A US federal judge on Friday ordered the Trump administration to provide emergency funding for a food aid program threatened with closure by the month-long government shutdown, court documents showed.

title: Delhi Court Directs Woman Who Ousted Husband From Property To Return Possession
content: A Delhi court has directed that a man ousted from his property by his wife be returned possession, saying the woman could not provide documents to prove ownership rights.

title: China Sends Its Youngest Astronaut, 4 Lab Mice To Space Station
content: A new crew took off for China's space station on Friday, including the country's youngest ever astronaut and four lab mice.

title: 17-Year-Old Girl, Friends Kill Her Mother, Stage Suicide In Bengaluru: Cops
content: A 17-year-old girl, along with her male friends, allegedly killed her mother and staged the crime as a suicide at their home in Uttarahalli, police said on Friday.

title: Cop Who Shot At Filmmaker Rohit Arya Sensed "Real Threat" Due To His Gun
content: The assistant inspector who fired at Mumbai hostage-taker Rohit Arya took the call since children were involved and the situation presented a "real threat", an official said on Friday.

title: Indian Man, 26, Dies In Crossfire Between Cops, Extortion Gang In Saudi Arabia
content: The Jharkhand labour department has contacted the Indian Embassy in Saudi Arabia to facilitate the return of the body of a 26-year-old youth from Dumri block in Giridih, who was killed in a shootout in Jeddah on October 16, officials said on Friday.

title: Louvre Museum To Soon Get Anti-Ramming Barriers: France Culture Minister
content: France's culture minister said Friday anti-ramming devices would be set up around the Louvre by year's end, after a high-profile heist at the famed museum reignited debate over its security.

title: Marine fisheries census launched
content: The 45-day nationwide enumeration will be conducted from November 3 to December 18 with the participation of thousands of trained field staff

title: Census self-enumeration trial run to begin in select areas from November 1
content: Usability of self-enumeration portal and the mobile application for Houselisting and Housing Census to be tested; 30 questions on household particulars likely to be asked during pre-test

title: Nehruâs âmistakeâ on Kashmir caused decades of turmoil and pain for nation: Modi
content: The Prime Minister noted the Kashmir region was ultimately divided by a separate constitution and emblem which engulfed the nation in turmoil for decades

title: Congress hid Muslim Leagueâs attacks on Patel: BJP
content: The BJP said the first attack took place on January 20, 1939, in Vadodara; soon after, the Muslim Leagueâs goon squads were allegedly plotting a deadlier assault in Bhavnagar, where Patel arrived on May 14, 1939, to lead the Fifth Praja Parishad

title: BJP criticises Congress chief Mallikarjun Khargeâs remarks against RSS
content: BJP cites previous praises given to the RSS by Congress leaders Mahatma Gandhi, B.R. Ambedkar, Jawaharlal Nehru, Indira Gandhi, Pranab Mukherjee; says RSS was cleared of involvement in Gandhijiâs assassination

title: Bihar Assembly election: Sudden twist in fortunes for an Independent in Mohania
content: After the ECIâs rejection of the RJD candidate, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav backs Independent Ravi Paswan; he will face sitting MLA Sangita Kumari, who recently switched loyalties from the RJD to the BJP

title: Congress mocks NDAâs â26-secondâ Bihar manifesto launch, says ruling alliance afraid to face questions
content: NDAâs leaders know âthey are not returning to power...so facing the publicâs questions felt like a waste of time to them,â says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh; notes Bihar CMâs silence at launch event

title: Union Health Ministry sets three Guinness World Records under womenâs health campaign
content: Records achieved under the Swasth Nari, Sashakt Parivar Abhiyaan for mass registration on health platforms and screenings

title: AIDSO condemns salary cut of doctors serving in rural areas
content: All India Democratic Students Organisation strongly condemns the decision of the State government and urges the latter to reverse it

title: No one can make a person stay in a party at gunpoint: Annamalai
content: BJP former State president dismisses reports that he may launch a new party, but hints at being conflicted over his current role in the organisation

title: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu and wife Bhuvaneswari for London on November 1
content: Bhuvaneswari to receive Institute of Directorsâ Distinguished Fellowship Award and Golden Peacock Award on November 4Â

title: Govt. to release â¹250 cr., hospitals agree to resume services under Dr. NTR Vaidya Seva
content: In successful talks with Andhra Pradesh Specialty Hospitals Association, Health Minister assures them of clearing other dues in one-time payment

title: DCC chief files complaint over stadium renovation works
content: Actions taken in the name of renovating the stadium for the now-cancelled match had resulted in criminal trespass, encroachment, illegal possession, alteration, and misuse of public property, says plaint

title: Caste survey: 6.13 crore of 6.85 crore population of Karnataka covered by end of physical survey
content: Commission Chairman Madhusudan Naik told The Hindu, âWe have the online window available till November 10 and the numbers could go up. We are expecting the number to reach 6.2 crore.â

title: Campaigning for Jubilee Hills Constituency in full swing
content: As many as 4,01,365 electors spread across 407 polling stations will decide the political fate of candidates in the fray: Bharat Rashtra Samithiâs Maganti Sunitha, Congressâ V. Naveen Yadav and the Bharatiya Janata Partyâs Lankala Deepak Reddy

title: NIMHANS study flags privacy, quality gaps in mental health apps available for Indian users
content: Only about one-sixth of the reviewed apps were developed in Asia, and just 10% originated from academic institutions, government bodies or non-profit organisations

title: Govt. gives Group-II post to son of slain former MLA
content: Maoists killed former MLA Siveri Soma and then sitting legislator Kidari Sarveswara Rao at Araku Valley in 2018

title: Sikh pilgrims get visa to travel to Pakistan as Centre revokes ban
content: Pakistan High Commission issues visa to 2,100 pilgrims to visit Sikh shrines; confusion prevails within the government over whose decision it was to stop and then restart the pilgrimages now; the Kartarpur Sahib corridor still remains shut

title: Maheshwar Rao directs officials to expedite white-topping work across 28 major roads
content: BWSSB has been directed to address multiple issues, including road reconstruction after pipeline works, drainage leakages, raising of manholes, and repair of cut sections where sewage is flowing onto the roads

title: Andhra Pradesh CM Naidu to disburse pensions in Sri Sathya Sai district on November 1
content: District Collector Shyam Prasad and Superintendent of Police Satheesh Kumar inspect the helipad, public meeting ground, and approach roads, and review the security and crowd management plans

title: Govt. releases â¹1,032 crore to clear pending dues and bills of employees and contractors
content: âEmployee payments and departmental bills will be cleared in a phased manner to ensure financial discipline and timely settlementâ

title: Leopard movement on Tirumala footpath triggers panic among devotees
content: Devotees trekkingÂ along the Srivari Mettu route spot the big cat crossing the pathway at the 150th step

title: Stray dogs case: Supreme Court declines virtual appearance for Chief Secretaries, says States âsleeping over ordersâ
content: The top court had earlier taken strong exception to the fact that several States and Union Territories had still not filed reports complying with its August 22 directive mandating the sterilisation, deworming, and immunisation of stray dogs

title: NLC India ready to invest â¹10,000 crore in solar power projects in Telangana: Kishan Reddy
content: Telangana has also received approval for 450MW of decentralised solar power plants, along with sanction for 40,000 rooftop solar units, of which 20,000 units will be installed in first phase by the Central government, says the Union Minister

title: Kerala Cricket Association office-bearers can be tried under Prevention of Corruption Act, says HC
content: Allegations of corruption land deals entered into by the cricket association. A single Bench had earlier ruled that KCA office-bearers did not fall within the ambit of âpublic servant.â

title: Data trail aids Cy-Hunt make headway
content: Data from the special drive revealed that online trading scams (34.8 %) topped the list of cyber financial crimes in Kerala

title: Kozhikode Corporation Council demands Election Commission to withhold SIR
content: The motion was unanimously supported by the UDF and LDF councillors, while the six BJP councillors opposed it

title: WTA Finals preview: Who's in and what to watch
content: the top eight singles players and eight doubles teams advance to the semifinals . the event ends on Nov. 8 with the singles champion earning up to $5.235 million in prize money and the winning doubles team earning a maximum of $1.139 million . a total of $15.5 million dollars will be awarded to each of their respective groups .

title: Follow live: Dodgers retain lead behind Yamamoto's stellar outing
content: Will the  2025 World Series  end tonight? Or are we destined for a Game 7? The  Toronto Blue Jays  return home needing just one win to take home their first title in 32 years. Meanwhile, Game 6 will determine whether the  Los Angeles Dodgers ' attempt to become the first team to repeat in 25 years will have a Halloween -- as opposed to a Hollywood -- ending. We're covering all the action -- from live in-game analysis to postgame takeaways -- right here. Key links:  World Series schedules, results Gamecast:   Follow the action pitch-by-pitch here
